body.p: I released version 2.0 of keychain (a SSH RSA/DSA key management application) today; this new release includes various bug fixes and performance improvements, commercial SSH2 support and HP-UX and Cygwin compatibility fixes. In addition, keychain files are now stored by default in a ~/.keychain/ directory and are now intuitively named sh-${HOSTNAME} and csh-${HOSTNAME}. Keychain 2.0 also includes a new command-line option --dir that can be used to set the location where Keychain will look for its files, and the --local option has been deprecated. You can grab Keychain on our Keychain projects page. Enjoy!
